Key Responsibilities
HR Data Management &amp; Reporting:


	Generate and analyze HR metrics such as headcount, turnover, absenteeism, and training participation.

	Track staffing levels across branches, depots, and logistics operations to support workforce planning.

	Monitor and track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for staff across departments.

	Participate in HR audits and ensure data accuracy for compliance purposes.

	Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
	Proficiency in HR software and Microsoft Office Suite.
	Ability to work under pressure and handle conflict professionally.
	Leadership and team management capability.


Salary

Human Resources (HR) Analyst Job at Rimdinado International Limited




        
    

        
        Rimdinado International Limited - Our client, a leading logistics firm in Enugu, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources (HR) Analyst

Job Location: Enugu
Employment Type: Full-Time
Reports To: HR Manager
Department: Human Resources

Key Responsibilities
HR Data Management & Reporting:


	Generate and analyze HR metrics such as headcount, turnover, absenteeism, and training participation.
	Prepare periodic HR dashboards and reports for management decision-making.


Workforce Analytics:
     

            
    




	Track staffing levels across branches, depots, and logistics operations to support workforce planning.
	Identify trends in recruitment, retention, and productivity using data insights.


Performance Management Support:


	Monitor and track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for staff across departments.
	Support HR Manager in implementing performance appraisal processes and performance-related analytics.


Recruitment & Onboarding Support:


	Support recruitment processes by maintaining candidate databases and tracking recruitment metrics (e.g., time-to-hire, source effectiveness).
	Assist in the orientation and documentation of new hires.


Compensation & Benefits Analysis:


	Assist in payroll verification and ensure accuracy of employee data before salary processing.
	Provide input for salary reviews and incentive planning.


HR Compliance & Record Keeping:


	Ensure employee records are properly documented and stored (digital and physical).
	Participate in HR audits and ensure data accuracy for compliance purposes.


Learning & Development Support:


	Maintain training databases and analyze participation, costs, and outcomes.
	Generate reports on skill gaps and recommend learning interventions.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree in any relevant field.


Key Skills & Competencies:


	Strong understanding of Nigerian labour laws and HR best practices.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
	Proficiency in HR software and Microsoft Office Suite.
	Ability to work under pressure and handle conflict professionally.
	Leadership and team management capability.


Salary
N200,000 - N450,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: rimdinado@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Security Operations Manager Job at LEAM Consulting




        
    

        
        LEAM Consulting is the foremost consulting firm which stands out in areas of professional certification training, HR advisory services, Business Development/Startup and IT consulting services in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Security Operations Manager

Job Location: Asaba, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Brief


	The ideal candidate must have a strong background in security management, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with other departments


Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Oversee and support the security team, assign security officers to specific patrol areas & Beat, ensure duties are performed effectively and address any issues providing training and disciplinary action where necessary
	Monitor team and individual performance, provide feedback, and hold regular team briefings.
	Manage day-to-day security operations and become familiar with the site layout or beat allocation to create and implement effective policies and procedures.
	Oversee day to day activities of each department in the office,Incident Management and Emergency
	Respond to and investigate any security breaches or incidents, escort unauthorized personnel from the site, conduct emergency drills, and assist with evacuation in an emergency, liaising with the emergency services where necessary.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an HND/B.Sc in any relevant field of study
	2-3 years of experience in a security role, with supervisory experience preferred.
	Strong knowledge of security protocols and emergency response procedures.
	Excellent leadership and team management skills.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills for interaction with staff and stakeholders.


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@leamconsulting.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more information contact recruiter via Whatsapp on: 09047710414.

Hotel General Manager Job at Auxium Corporate Services Limited




        
    

        
        Auxium Corporate Services Limited - Our client, a big player in the hospitality industry, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Hotel General Manager

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Reports to: Managing Director
Work Schedule: Flexible shift with a day off

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The hotel general manager is a hospitality professional who is responsible for executing the strategic goals of a hotel and ensuring that everyone is performing in alignment with those goals.
	They oversee overall operations with the overarching goal of creating the best guest experience possible.


Job Responsibilities


	Ensure guest satisfaction by making sure that guest’s needs are met.
	The environment is well maintained, and carrying out quality control to ensure that the rooms and facilities are in top shape.
	Hold meetings with department heads and assistant managers.
	These meetings are used to address any changes in policies and update managers on strategic goals, working together to make sure they are met, and assess progress.
	And to also oversee staff’s compliance with operational and service level agreements and procedures.
	The General Manager is responsible for ensuring the hotel’s profitability as it relates to revenue targets and budgeting across departments.
	The GM is responsible for setting out a training program, both to develop staff and to ensure that health, safety, and security regulations are followed.
	The more people the GM can grow within the organization, the more committed those staff will be to ensure the success of the hotel’s operations.
	Identify and help ensure the execution of strategic goals.
	Work with department managers to set out a roadmap to meeting these goals, and identify the KPIs that will help keep track of their completion, including the individual tasks that must be carried out to make them possible.


Requirements


	15+ years of hotel management experience
	Proven track record of revenue growth and guest satisfaction
	Strong leadership and management skills
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Hospitality Degree or certification (e.g. Hotel Administration, Hospitality Management) but any B.Sc degree or Masters with good experience can apply.
	Experience with hotel management software (e.g. PMS, RMS)
	Knowledge of labor laws and regulations.


Job Benefits


	Competitive salary: Very attractive & competitive (to be discussed) and benefits package
	Opportunities for professional growth and development
	Collaborative and dynamic work environment
	Recognition and reward for outstanding performance.
